course_title: Practical Lawyering Skills: Pro Bono in Practice (Practicum)
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 12 / Seats Avail: 2Waitlist Total: 0 of 3
class_notes:
Final Assessment: Paper/Project
Students will be expected to observe in-person court proceedings in Fulton, Cobb, or DeKalb County. Students will have the option to represent an actual client if they have completed the Student Practice Act certification, observed the court they will be representing a client in, and attended the required in-class training.
course_description: This course will provide a holistic overview of pro bono work, examining why lawyers can (and should) do pro bono, discussing how to do pro bono well, and developing practical skills that students can leverage for success in the private law firm context. Through Pro Bono in Practice, students will develop client management, communication, counseling, and interviewing skills, learn basic landlord/tenant and domestic violence law in Georgia, and practice newly developed skills through simulated and/or actual client representations.
sections: Class Nbr: 2725, Section #: 001, Type: PRA, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 5-7p, Instructor: S. Babcock, Status: Open
